article.headline: La Salle 67, Richmond 56
article.story: RICHMOND, Va. (AP) -- Darnell Harris scored 12 of his 15 points in the first half Saturday night to lead La Salle to a 67-56 victory over Richmond. Harris scored nine points in a 21-6 run midway through the first half as La Salle (10-2, 2-0 Atlantic 10) took a 25-13 lead with 7:45 remaining. Richmond could get no closer than six the rest of the half, and the Explorers led 35-25 at the break. The Spiders (7-7, 0-1) cut the lead to 43-42 on Oumar Sylla's 3-pointer with 11:22 remaining. Steven Smith's three-point play gave the Explorers a 46-42 lead with 11:01 remaining, and La Salle gradually built a 14-point lead. Smith had 14 points for the Explorers while Marshall Taylor and Mike St. John each contributed 11 off the bench. Richmond's Gaston Moliva scored 14 points on 5-of-5 shooting from the field. Peter Thomas hit his first five field goal attempts and finished with 13 points for the Spiders.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
